reason: INCOMPLETE SUPREMUM BOUND IN STEP A.2: The argument that the L^p growth rate p^{k/2} is preserved when passing from individual Littlewood-Paley coefficients Delta_j :phi_eps^k:(x) (which are genuine chaos-k elements) to the Besov norm sup_{j>=0} 2^{-j(k/2+delta)} sup_x |Delta_j :phi_eps^k:(x)| is stated without proof. The supremum over the spatial variable x and the dyadic index j requires an entropy/chaining argument (standard in Gaussian chaos theory) to verify that no additional p-dependent factors are introduced. While this gap is fillable with standard tools, it should be made explicit.
